Each course application is to be accompanied by 1 CP Form.', '(A) WSQ Singular Course', '(B) WSQ Integrated Course*', '*WSQ Integrated course refers to a course application with more than 1 Technical Skills and Competencies', '(TSC) but not leading to a full qualification.', 'For application of WSQ Full Qualification, please click here:', 'https://www.tpgateway.gov.sg/plan-courses/course-accreditation select “What do I need for the application? s/no b.”'], 'Part 1:  Particulars of Course': [{'table': [['Application Reference Number as generated in TPGateway', 'TPG-2024063639'], ['Type of Course Application you are applying', '(A) WSQ Singular Course

[Please select 1 option only]'], ['Name of your Organisation

LTD.'], ['Course Title', 'Create Engaging Social E-Commerce Campaigns on XiaoHongShu'], ['Technical Skills and Competency (TSC)/Critical Core Skill Title(s) (CCS) that your Course is being mapped to (As per title in the TSC / CCS Document)', 'TSC/CCS code'], ['E-Commerce Campaign Management', 'TOU-SNM-3014-1.1-1']]}, {'table': [['Breakdown of Course Components (in hours1)'], ['Classroom facilitation', '7 hours'], ['Workplace learning: On-the-Job (OJT)2', 'N.A.'], ['Practicum3', 'N.A.'], ['Practical4', '7 hours'], ['E-learning', 'Synchronous', 'N.A.'], ['E-learning', 'Asynchronous', 'N.A.'], ['Assessment 
(Note: Training Providers are to ensure there are at least 2 modes of assessment for each course application).
Some of the examples include:
Work-related Projects/Assignments/Presentation 
Written Assessment
Oral Questioning
Simulation(e.g. Role Play etc)', '2 hours'], ['Total Duration (in hours1)', '16 hours']]}, 'Note:', 'Hours indicated must align with Section 3E and Training Partners Gateway application form. Blended learning is the use of an appropriate mix of classroom learning, e-learning (e.g., Learning Management System or technology-enabled learning e.g., virtual reality) and workplace learning (e.g. OJT or practicum) to improve learning efficacy and accessibility.', 'Training Providers are only required to submit the OJT Task Analysis form which is downloadable from https://www.tpgateway.gov.sg/plan-courses/course-accreditation and select “What do I need for the application?” s/no d to complete the Form.', 'Practicum training refers to structured supervised training carried out in a controlled environment outside the workplace that allows trainees to have supervised practical application of the training.', 'Practical work is defined as learning through hands-on activities within an environment designed to mirror real work applications with the intent to improve specific skills. Examples include chefs practising their culinary skills in a kitchen within the training institution; nursing professionals learning to handle medical equipment within a simulated healthcare setting; and aircraft engineers learning how to solder.'], 'Part 2:  Background': [{'table': [['To provide an overview of the research that was conducted to determine the need for the course. This section must cover:'], ["Targeted sector(s) background and needs for the training.
SkillsFuture’s report Skills Demand For The Future Economy (https://www.skillsfuture.gov.sg/skillsreport) published in 2022, spotlights the priority skills and jobs in demand in three specially selected, emerging, high-growth areas. This report is designed for Singaporeans as a resource for an individual’s skills development journey over the next one to three years.  Singapore’s key growth areas (Digital, Green & Care Economy) bring exciting job and skills opportunities. It also introduced the idea of ‘priority skills which are highly transferable skills across job roles within the three economies. In other words, these skills are applicable in many job roles and will contribute significantly to the individual’s long-term career versatility. A new dimension on skills demands growth has been added and analysed alongside skills transferability. Demand growth captures the relative scale of the increase in demand for that skill, while transferability captures the scope of the skill’s applicability across different job roles. The two-dimensional analysis seeks to provide deeper insights to the reader into the nature of the priority skills identified. 

In the tourism industry, the landscape of marketing has shifted dramatically with the advent of social e-commerce platforms like XiaoHongShu (Little Red Book). One of the prominent challenges faced by the industry is adapting to the rapidly changing digital environment. Traditional marketing strategies may no longer yield the desired results as consumers increasingly turn to social media for travel inspiration and recommendations. Additionally, there's a growing need to engage with potential travellers authentically and creatively amidst stiff competition. Performance gaps arise due to a lack of proficiency in leveraging platforms like XiaoHongShu effectively, resulting in missed opportunities to reach and engage with target audiences.
To address the performance gaps prevalent in the tourism industry, training programs focusing on creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on platforms like XiaoHongShu are essential. These programs should equip professionals with the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate the intricacies of social media marketing in the context of tourism. Training modules should cover areas such as content creation tailored to the platform's audience, understanding consumer behaviour on social e-commerce platforms, utilizing influencers for effective promotion, and leveraging analytics for campaign optimization. Practical hands-on exercises and case studies can provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of how to develop and execute successful campaigns.
The targeted job roles for this training would include marketing managers, digital marketing specialists, social media managers, and content creators within the tourism industry. These professionals are responsible for conceptualizing, implementing, and monitoring marketing campaigns aimed at attracting travellers."], ["Performance gaps that the course will address. Please elaborate how the performance gaps were identified (e.g., market research, focus group discussions, surveys etc) and how the attributes gained post training would benefit learners.


Performance gaps were identified through survey forms distributed to external stakeholders:

Performance gaps:
Learners lack understanding of how to align XiaoHongShu e-commerce campaigns with strategic marketing objectives.
Learners struggle to analyze XiaoHongShu campaign outcomes using sales performance data and consumer insights effectively.
Learners lack proficiency in analyzing e-commerce trends and customer reviews on XiaoHongShu's Shop.

Through targeted training programs, learners will gain the following attributes to address the identified performance gaps after the training.

Attributes gained:
Proficiency in aligning XiaoHongShu e-commerce campaigns with strategic marketing objectives, ensuring campaigns contribute to overarching organizational goals.
Capability to effectively analyze XiaoHongShu campaign outcomes by interpreting sales performance data and consumer insights, leading to data-driven decision-making for campaign optimization.
Competence in analyzing e-commerce trends and customer reviews on XiaoHongShu's Shop, enabling learners to identify emerging trends and respond effectively to customer feedback to enhance campaign performance and customer satisfaction."]]}], 'Part 3:	Curriculum Design': [{'table': [['Course Learning Outcome  
Outline what the learner will achieve from the completion of this course. These outcomes are a general description of his/her newly acquired level of skills, Knowledge (K) and Abilities (A) (i.e.  What can he/she do? What does he/she know?).
(Please ensure these outcomes address the Performance gaps as indicated in Part 2ii.)

Sequencing of Learning Units / Modules
Provide rationale to explain how and why the learning units (LUs)/learning outcomes (LOs) are being sequenced in a particular manner to achieve the course objectives. 
(Please ensure that the LUs and LOs stated here aligns with Part 3C.)']]}, {'table': [["Please explain the rationale for sequencing.

For this course, the step-by-step sequencing is essential to ensure learners acquire a comprehensive understanding and practical skills in creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on XiaoHongShu. The methodology is designed to scaffold learners' knowledge and application abilities systematically, starting from fundamental concepts and progressing to more advanced skills. This approach ensures learners build a solid foundation before advancing to more complex topics, fostering deeper comprehension and effective application of the learned concepts in real-world scenarios.

Here's how each Learning Unit (LU) aligns with the step-by-step sequencing methodology based on the course outline:

LU1: Setup E-Commerce Campaign Management with XiaoHongShu
This initial unit introduces learners to the key elements of e-commerce campaign management on XiaoHongShu, emphasizing the importance of aligning campaigns with strategic marketing objectives. By first understanding the fundamental elements and effective communication strategies on XiaoHongShu, learners can grasp the basics of executing successful e-commerce campaigns, setting the stage for more in-depth learning in subsequent units.

LU2: Monitor and Analyze E-Commerce Performance
Building upon the foundational knowledge gained in LU1, this unit delves into monitoring and analyzing e-commerce performance on XiaoHongShu. Learners will explore listing and advertising products effectively, understanding various advertising media options, and mastering techniques to monitor and analyze online sales performance. By acquiring these skills, learners can evaluate the effectiveness of their campaigns and make data-driven decisions for optimization.

LU3: Analyze Social Trends and Customer Feedbacks
In the final unit, learners will focus on analyzing social trends and customer feedback on XiaoHongShu's shop. They will learn to schedule their social e-commerce campaigns effectively, analyze trends and patterns from campaign analysis, and monitor customer feedback and reviews. This unit ties everything together by emphasizing the importance of staying updated with trends and leveraging customer feedback to refine and enhance e-commerce campaigns, completing the curriculum framework with a holistic understanding of creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on XiaoHongShu."], ['Learning Units (LUs)', 'TPs to indicate topics covered under each LU and state Learning Outcomes (LOs)
[Against each LO, please indicate the topics and list down the numbering and description for the “K” and “A” Statements in the TSC/CCS document]'], ['LU1: Setup E-Commerce Campaign Management with XiaoHongShu', 'Topics:
Topic 1: Setup E-Commerce Campaign Management with XiaoHongShu (K1, K2, A1)
Key elements of e-commerce campaign with XiaoHongShu (K1)
Communicating effectively on XiaoHongShu (Little Red Book)  (K2)
How to execute an effective e-commerce campaign on XiaoHongShu (Little Red Book) (A1)

LO1 – Implement XiaoHongShu e-commerce campaigns in alignment to strategic marketing objectives.

K1: E-Commerce campaign execution tactics
K2: Messages to be communicated
A1: Execute e-Commerce campaigns in alignment to e-Commerce strategies, sales and marketing strategies'], ['LU2: Monitor and Analyze E-Commerce Performance', 'Topics:
Topic 2: Monitor and Analyze E-Commerce Performance (K3, K4, A2, A3)
List and advertise products online on XiaoHongShu (K3)
Advertising media options available on XiaoHongShu (K4)
Monitor e-commerce performance (A2)
Analyze online sales performance (A3)

LO2 – Analyse XiaoHongShu campaign outcomes using sales performance data and consumer insights.

K3: Methods to advertise products online
K4: Possible media options
A2: Monitor campaign performance and effectiveness in accordance with performance measures
A3: Analyse information on e-commerce sales and customer feedback'], ['LU3: Analyze Social Trends and Customer Feedbacks', 'Topics:
Topic 3: Analyze Social Trends and Customer Feedbacks  (K5, K6, A4, A5)
Decide your social e-Commerce campaign schedules (K5)
Analyze e-commerce trends and patterns from campaign analysis on XiaoHongShu (K6, A4)
Monitor customer feedback and review (A5)

LO3 – Analyse e-Commerce trends and customer review on XiaoHongShu’s Shop.

K5: Campaign schedules
K6: Means of using data gathered from pre-campaign testing
A4: Identify e-Commerce trends and patterns from campaign analysis
A5: Monitor social media platforms or online blog or vlog and forums related platforms for customer feedback or review']]}, '*add/delete table rows as necessary', {'table': [['C. Curriculum Key Features
This table outlines the important features of the curriculum design that underpin the course. It is not required to state the full description of the Knowledge and Ability statements here.', {'table': [['CR – Classroom learning', 'Sync e-learning – Synchronous e-learning', 'Async e-learning – Asynchronous e-learning', 'PP – Practical / Practicum', 'OJT – On-the-job Training']]}, 'D. Details of Instructional Methods Proposed', {'table': [['Instructional Methods', 'Trainer-to-learner ratio
(Indicate min and max ratio)', 'Elaborate on appropriateness of instructional methods'], ['Lecture', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', "Lecture is an instructional method commonly used by facilitators to impart knowledge to their learners. A lecture is a prepared oral presentation on a given topic. Lectures comprise content delivery supported by examples to illustrate principles and concepts. The content is generally not lengthy and combines other presentation and application methods. The activities for the lecture include presentation, slideshow and note-taking. 

Lecturing is an inevitable part of classroom learning. It allows the facilitator to deliver information to learners as planned. This gives excellent control over what is taught and lets the facilitator be the sole source of information to avoid confusion.

The facilitator can present the material during the lecture and answer learners' questions. Learners can receive, take in and respond. This enhances a well-organised pattern of ideas, enabling learners to better grasp the principles and concepts."], ['Didactic Questioning', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Didactic questioning can ensure learners follow the presentation and understand the concepts. 
Didactic questioning follows a pre-determined set of questions to lead learners to certain realisations or conclusions or to help them meet a specific learning outcome'], ['Demonstration', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Demonstration is an effective instructional method used by facilitators to show learners how to perform specific tasks or complete processes. It is a visual and hands-on approach that can teach various subjects and skills. 

The use of demonstration in teaching has several benefits, including:
It helps learners to understand complex concepts and processes by breaking them down into smaller, more manageable steps.
It gives learners a clear and concrete example of performing a task or completing a process.
It allows learners to see the results of their work in real-time, which can be motivating and rewarding.
It encourages active participation and engagement from learners, which can help to improve learning outcomes.'], ['Practical', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Practical is an instructional method that allows learners to apply what they have learned in a real-world context, which can help reinforce their understanding of the material. 

The use of the practice in teaching has several benefits, including:
It helps learners develop their skills and knowledge by providing opportunities to apply what they have learned in a real-world context.
It can help to reinforce learning by providing learners with feedback on their performance and identifying areas where they need to improve.
It can help build learners’ confidence by allowing them to practice and refine their skills.
It can help to prepare learners for future challenges by providing them with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed.']]}, 'E. Details of Assessment Methods Proposed', {'table': [['Assessment Methods
(e.g., open/closed book assessment, summative/continuous assessment)', 'Assessor-to-candidate ratio
(Indicate min and max ratio)', 'Elaborate on appropriateness of assessment methods'], ['Written Assessment - Short-Answer Questions (WA-SAQ) 

Individual, Summative, Open book', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Written Assessment - Short-Answer Questions (WA-SAQ) assessment will provide direct evidence of whether the candidates have acquired the underlying knowledge through written questions and answers
Written Assessment - Short-Answer Questions (WA-SAQ) assessment consists of open-ended questions that require candidates to create an answer to each question. It is effective for assessing the knowledge of a topic.'], ['Practical Performance 
(PP)

Individual, Summative, Open book', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'A practical Performance (PP) assessment will provide direct evidence of whether candidates have acquired the competency for the ability statements by solving a scenario-based problem. 

Practical Performance (PP) assessment is an experience-based form of evaluation that captures the performance in the context of a meaningful task, emphasising how well a candidate knows the content and outcomes rather than just whether they can complete a given checklist or set of requirements.
Practical Performance (PP) assessment allows candidates to use their skills authentically. It can be used to assess abilities relevant to a particular job function.'], ['Remarks: Oral Clarification will be conducted in a setting where the assessor-to-candidate ratio is 1:1 on a need basis to close minor performance gaps in the PP and WA-SAQ. Duration of up to 5 mins is allocated, which is not included in the assessment duration']]}, 'This additional section is to be completed only by Training Providers appointed under the Critical Core Skills Call-for-Proposal:', {'table': [['1. Please indicate the *thematic focus area(s) to which this course is aligned.


N.A.'], ['2. Please provide details of the experiential learning (including actual practice and immersion for soft skills acquisition) incorporated within your course design. 


N.A.']]}, '*This refers to the 3 pre-defined themes for CCS courses stipulated under the CFP requirements: (A) CCS for Career-Learning-Planning; (B) CCS to Support Change Management at the Workplace; and (C) CCS for Business Resilience. The thematic focus areas have been introduced to guide TPs in developing CCS modules for more effective outcomes, while adopting more innovative curriculum and instructional design. Each course should typically be aligned to one thematic focus area.'], 'Part 4:	Facilities and Resources': [{'table': [['Classroom Facilitation/Assessment
Provide images and the details of the facility and equipment supporting the delivery and assessment specific for the applied course.'], ["Training venue: 12 Woodlands Square #07-85/86/87 Woods Square Tower 1, Singapore 737715

We recommend learners bring their laptops for practice. We will provide spare laptops for those learners without a laptop.

The Safe Management Measures (SMM) is not required. However, we have measures to ensure that we are well-prepared to activate SMM upon short notice. Our staff has received training on the proper implementation of SMM, and we have contingency plans to adapt our operations to changing circumstances. 

The training room setup is shown below

- Table and chairs for 24 pax max
- 75” inch TV
- 1Gps WIFI
- Whiteboard, markers, erasers






Assessment arrangement for WA-SAQ and PP

Assessment venue:  12 Woodlands Square #07-85/86/87 Woods Square Tower 1, Singapore 737715

We recommend candidates bring their laptops for assessment. We will provide spare laptops for those candidates without a laptop.

The candidate's seating arrangement will be adjusted if necessary during the assessments to ensure optimal test-taking conditions and facilitate a fair evaluation for all participants.

Classroom setup for PP and WA-SAQ:

- Table and chairs for 24 pax max
- 75” inch TV
- 1Gps WIFI
- Whiteboard, markers, erasers





Classroom setup for Oral Clarification: 


- Table and chairs
- 55” inch TV
- 1Gps WIFI
- Whiteboard, markers, erasers"], ['Workplace Learning/Assessment
Provide images and the details of the facility and equipment supporting the delivery/assessment.'], ['This is not applicable as there is no workplace training and no workplace assessment'], ['Synchronous and Asynchronous E-Learning/E-Assessment
Provide details on the system capability to authenticate learners’ identities.'], ['This is not applicable as there is no e-learning/ assessment'], ['Provide details on the system capability to validate attendance records & track learners’ progress.
Note: Administrator rights to Learning Management System (LMS) to be granted to SSG, if applicable.'], ['Provide details of how the trainer/instructor support is available for trainee who need further clarification or assistance.'], ['Provide details of how the technical helpdesk support is available.'], ['Provide details of the authentication process to verify trainee identity, enable the conduct of e-assessments and ensure accuracy and authenticity of the assessment results.'], ['Note: The 2 criteria listed below are applicable only for Asynchronous E-Learning application for evaluation on Absentee Payroll (AP) funding eligibility. Training Providers are required to provide the following information: The information provided is applicable to all subsequent course runs.
State Asynchronous E-Learning duration; and
Indicate if Asynchronous E-Learning duration is part of the training duration.'], ['Provide details on the course commencement date, course end date and the estimated number of learning hours expected to complete the course.'], ['Provide details on the instructor facilitation (conducted online without the need for such facilitation to be real-time or face-to-face).']]}], 'Part 5:	Monitoring and Evaluation': [{'table': [['Tracking of Outcomes
Indicate how the learning outcomes will be measured and tracked using Kirkpatrick’s four levels of evaluation model.'], ['TP to provide details on 4 levels of Kirkpatrick’s evaluation model where applicable:

For Training Providers appointed under the Critical Core Skills Call-for-Proposal, please put a tick () in the box below:
 We hereby commit to adhering to the outcomes stipulated under the deliverables for the CCS CFP.']]}], 'Part 6:	Audit Outcome of SSG’s Evaluation': [{'table': [['Overall Assessment'], [''], ['Status of Accreditation'], ['Pass Audit      Fail Audit'], ['', 'Name of Officer', 'Designation', 'Division', 'Date'], ['Audited by:', ''], ['Recommended by:', ''], ['Approved by:', '']]}]}}
    2. Fix spelling errors, and missing LUs if any.
    3. Ensure that the LUs do not have the same name as the Topics.
    4. Return a full JSON object with all the extracted data according to the schema.

        ],

This section must cover:'], ["Targeted sector(s) background and needs for the training.
SkillsFuture’s report Skills Demand For The Future Economy (https://www.skillsfuture.gov.sg/skillsreport) published in 2022, spotlights the priority skills and jobs in demand in three specially selected, emerging, high-growth areas. This report is designed for Singaporeans as a resource for an individual’s skills development journey over the next one to three years.  Singapore’s key growth areas (Digital, Green & Care Economy) bring exciting job and skills opportunities. It also introduced the idea of ‘priority skills which are highly transferable skills across job roles within the three economies. In other words, these skills are applicable in many job roles and will contribute significantly to the individual’s long-term career versatility. A new dimension on skills demands growth has been added and analysed alongside skills transferability. Demand growth captures the relative scale of the increase in demand for that skill, while transferability captures the scope of the skill’s applicability across different job roles. The two-dimensional analysis seeks to provide deeper insights to the reader into the nature of the priority skills identified. 

In the tourism industry, the landscape of marketing has shifted dramatically with the advent of social e-commerce platforms like XiaoHongShu (Little Red Book). One of the prominent challenges faced by the industry is adapting to the rapidly changing digital environment. Traditional marketing strategies may no longer yield the desired results as consumers increasingly turn to social media for travel inspiration and recommendations. Additionally, there's a growing need to engage with potential travellers authentically and creatively amidst stiff competition. Performance gaps arise due to a lack of proficiency in leveraging platforms like XiaoHongShu effectively, resulting in missed opportunities to reach and engage with target audiences.
To address the performance gaps prevalent in the tourism industry, training programs focusing on creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on platforms like XiaoHongShu are essential. These programs should equip professionals with the skills and knowledge necessary to navigate the intricacies of social media marketing in the context of tourism. Training modules should cover areas such as content creation tailored to the platform's audience, understanding consumer behaviour on social e-commerce platforms, utilizing influencers for effective promotion, and leveraging analytics for campaign optimization. Practical hands-on exercises and case studies can provide participants with a comprehensive understanding of how to develop and execute successful campaigns.
The targeted job roles for this training would include marketing managers, digital marketing specialists, social media managers, and content creators within the tourism industry. These professionals are responsible for conceptualizing, implementing, and monitoring marketing campaigns aimed at attracting travellers."], ["Performance gaps that the course will address. Please elaborate how the performance gaps were identified (e.g., market research, focus group discussions, surveys etc) and how the attributes gained post training would benefit learners.


Performance gaps were identified through survey forms distributed to external stakeholders:

Performance gaps:
Learners lack understanding of how to align XiaoHongShu e-commerce campaigns with strategic marketing objectives.
Learners struggle to analyze XiaoHongShu campaign outcomes using sales performance data and consumer insights effectively.
Learners lack proficiency in analyzing e-commerce trends and customer reviews on XiaoHongShu's Shop.

Through targeted training programs, learners will gain the following attributes to address the identified performance gaps after the training.

Attributes gained:
Proficiency in aligning XiaoHongShu e-commerce campaigns with strategic marketing objectives, ensuring campaigns contribute to overarching organizational goals.
Capability to effectively analyze XiaoHongShu campaign outcomes by interpreting sales performance data and consumer insights, leading to data-driven decision-making for campaign optimization.
Competence in analyzing e-commerce trends and customer reviews on XiaoHongShu's Shop, enabling learners to identify emerging trends and respond effectively to customer feedback to enhance campaign performance and customer satisfaction."]]}], 'Part 3:	Curriculum Design': [{'table': [['Course Learning Outcome  
Outline what the learner will achieve from the completion of this course. These outcomes are a general description of his/her newly acquired level of skills, Knowledge (K) and Abilities (A) (i.e.  What can he/she do? What does he/she know?).
(Please ensure these outcomes address the Performance gaps as indicated in Part 2ii.)

Sequencing of Learning Units / Modules
Provide rationale to explain how and why the learning units (LUs)/learning outcomes (LOs) are being sequenced in a particular manner to achieve the course objectives. 
(Please ensure that the LUs and LOs stated here aligns with Part 3C.)']]}, {'table': [["Please explain the rationale for sequencing.

For this course, the step-by-step sequencing is essential to ensure learners acquire a comprehensive understanding and practical skills in creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on XiaoHongShu. The methodology is designed to scaffold learners' knowledge and application abilities systematically, starting from fundamental concepts and progressing to more advanced skills. This approach ensures learners build a solid foundation before advancing to more complex topics, fostering deeper comprehension and effective application of the learned concepts in real-world scenarios.

Here's how each Learning Unit (LU) aligns with the step-by-step sequencing methodology based on the course outline:

LU1: Setup E-Commerce Campaign Management with XiaoHongShu
This initial unit introduces learners to the key elements of e-commerce campaign management on XiaoHongShu, emphasizing the importance of aligning campaigns with strategic marketing objectives. By first understanding the fundamental elements and effective communication strategies on XiaoHongShu, learners can grasp the basics of executing successful e-commerce campaigns, setting the stage for more in-depth learning in subsequent units.

LU2: Monitor and Analyze E-Commerce Performance
Building upon the foundational knowledge gained in LU1, this unit delves into monitoring and analyzing e-commerce performance on XiaoHongShu. Learners will explore listing and advertising products effectively, understanding various advertising media options, and mastering techniques to monitor and analyze online sales performance. By acquiring these skills, learners can evaluate the effectiveness of their campaigns and make data-driven decisions for optimization.

LU3: Analyze Social Trends and Customer Feedbacks
In the final unit, learners will focus on analyzing social trends and customer feedback on XiaoHongShu's shop. They will learn to schedule their social e-commerce campaigns effectively, analyze trends and patterns from campaign analysis, and monitor customer feedback and reviews. This unit ties everything together by emphasizing the importance of staying updated with trends and leveraging customer feedback to refine and enhance e-commerce campaigns, completing the curriculum framework with a holistic understanding of creating engaging social e-commerce campaigns on XiaoHongShu."], ['Learning Units (LUs)', 'TPs to indicate topics covered under each LU and state Learning Outcomes (LOs)

(Indicate min and max ratio)', 'Elaborate on appropriateness of instructional methods'], ['Lecture', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', "Lecture is an instructional method commonly used by facilitators to impart knowledge to their learners. A lecture is a prepared oral presentation on a given topic. Lectures comprise content delivery supported by examples to illustrate principles and concepts. The content is generally not lengthy and combines other presentation and application methods. The activities for the lecture include presentation, slideshow and note-taking. 

Lecturing is an inevitable part of classroom learning. It allows the facilitator to deliver information to learners as planned. This gives excellent control over what is taught and lets the facilitator be the sole source of information to avoid confusion.

The facilitator can present the material during the lecture and answer learners' questions. Learners can receive, take in and respond. This enhances a well-organised pattern of ideas, enabling learners to better grasp the principles and concepts."], ['Didactic Questioning', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Didactic questioning can ensure learners follow the presentation and understand the concepts. 
Didactic questioning follows a pre-determined set of questions to lead learners to certain realisations or conclusions or to help them meet a specific learning outcome'], ['Demonstration', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Demonstration is an effective instructional method used by facilitators to show learners how to perform specific tasks or complete processes. It is a visual and hands-on approach that can teach various subjects and skills. 

The use of demonstration in teaching has several benefits, including:
It helps learners to understand complex concepts and processes by breaking them down into smaller, more manageable steps.
It gives learners a clear and concrete example of performing a task or completing a process.
It allows learners to see the results of their work in real-time, which can be motivating and rewarding.
It encourages active participation and engagement from learners, which can help to improve learning outcomes.'], ['Practical', '1:3 (Min)
1:20 (Max)', 'Practical is an instructional method that allows learners to apply what they have learned in a real-world context, which can help reinforce their understanding of the material. 

The use of the practice in teaching has several benefits, including:
It helps learners develop their skills and knowledge by providing opportunities to apply what they have learned in a real-world context.
It can help to reinforce learning by providing learners with feedback on their performance and identifying areas where they need to improve.
It can help build learners’ confidence by allowing them to practice and refine their skills.
It can help to prepare learners for future challenges by providing them with the skills and knowledge they need to succeed.']]}, 'E. Details of Assessment Methods Proposed', {'table': [['Assessment Methods
(e.g., open/closed book assessment, summative/continuous assessment)', 'Assessor-to-candidate ratio

1:20 (Max)', 'A practical Performance (PP) assessment will provide direct evidence of whether candidates have acquired the competency for the ability statements by solving a scenario-based problem. 

Practical Performance (PP) assessment is an experience-based form of evaluation that captures the performance in the context of a meaningful task, emphasising how well a candidate knows the content and outcomes rather than just whether they can complete a given checklist or set of requirements.
Practical Performance (PP) assessment allows candidates to use their skills authentically.
